noun.description: An arrangement or design consisting of columns of short parallel lines, with all the lines in one column sloping one way and all the lines in the next column sloping the other way so as to resemble the bones in a fish, used especially in the weave of cloth or the placing of bricks.
A method of ascending a slope by walking forward in alternate steps with each ski angled outward.

verb.description: Ascend a slope using the herringbone technique.
examples: we learned how to herringbone up the hills and swoosh down them
